selectedVerses.text: And the king returned from the palace garden to the place where they were drinking wine, as Haman was falling on the couch where Esther was. And the king said, "Will he even assault the queen in my presence, in my own house?" As the word left the mouth of the king, they covered Haman's face.
You sat on a stately couch, with a table spread before it on which you had placed my incense and my oil.
I have spread my couch with coverings, colored linens from Egyptian linen;
When I say, 'My bed will comfort me, my couch will ease my complaint,'

And David invited him, and he ate in his presence and drank, so that he made him drunk. And in the evening he went out to lie on his couch with the servants of his lord, but he did not go down to his house.
